Comment: Hi everyone, this game was part of a training match for an upcoming tournament. Played O.T.B., without use of a Game DB or openings book.
The Slav Defence, my opponent's favourite reply against 1.d4.
The Slav Defence, my opponent's favourite reply against 1.d4.
The Slav Defence, my opponent's favourite reply against 1.d4.
The Meran complex contains a large number of variations. The Meran variation of the Semi-Slav Defense is reached when after 1.d4 d5 2.c4 c6 3.Nf3 Nf6 4.Nc3 black plays 4...e6.

The most played move. Another possibility is 5.Bg5 when black can play 5... dxc4, the Botvinnik variation. For more on that variation take a look at the annotated game by chessy131: Semi-Slav: Botvinnik variation chessy131 (2008) vs. be8ki (2100)
Black follows the main line too.
This is the main line of the Meran.

This is the main line of the Meran.
Now black has three main options: 8... a6, 8... Bb7 or the Neo-Meran with 8... b4.
But we'll stick to the main line.
The next moves are all theory.
Only move.
White gains control in the centre.
So black has to reply.
Best move.

An 'improvement' on the old fashion line with 12...Bb7! The game Botwinnik-Simagin, Russian Championship 1951, continued with 13.O-O gxf6 14.Bxb5 Rg8 15.Bf4 Ra5 16.a4 Rxb5! 17.axb5 Ne5 18.Bxe5 fxe5, with good play for black.

An 'improvement' on the old fashion line with 12...Bb7! The game Botwinnik-Simagin, Russian Championship 1951, continued with 13.O-O gxf6 14.Bxb5 Rg8 15.Bf4 Ra5 16.a4 Rxb5! 17.axb5 Ne5 18.Bxe5 fxe5, with good play for black.
? 13.fxg7 is suggested by theory and considered slightly better then the text-move.
? My opponent leaves all theory behind and duly gets punished by making the first mistake. 13... gxf6 would still have been a theoretically known position.
! Capturing an important central pawn. The knight is protected by a discovered check on b5.
Protecting the isolated b5 pawn and eliminating the check, so now the knight on d4 is no longer protected.
Developing pieces.
Developing pieces.
16.Be3 followed by something like 16... Qb8 was another possibility I looked at, but I decided to fianchetto my bishop to b2, setting up a double-barreled shotgun with the bishops.
